alert.note: Alert for Fergus (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:23PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fergus County through 500 PM MDT... At 422 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grass Range, or 23 miles west of Winnett, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Grass Range. This includes the following highways... Highway 200 between mile markers 107 and 123. Highway 191 between mile markers 37 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for central Montana.
